meaningMnemonic: You go to buy a <radical>table</radical> but it looks like it has water damage from <radical>drop</radical>s of water hitting it. This makes it a pretty <kanji>mediocre</kanji> table. The water drops haven't really damaged it that much, it still stands and you can use it, but it's kinda ugly, so it's just mediocre.
readingMnemonic: You weren't expecting to see such a <kanji>mediocre</kanji> table so you go up to the guy who's selling it and say, "Hey, I have a <reading>bone</reading> (ぼん) to pick with you!" But he doesn't think there is a bone to pick at all, he doesn't think the table is mediocre like you do.
